bibl.title: Letter from Clyde F. Karshner to Emilie Lawrence Reed, January 22, 1927

div1.p: Karshner thanks Emilie Lawrence Reed for materials she sent concerning Walter Reed.

div1.head: Letter from Clyde F. Karshner to Emilie Lawrence Reed, January 22, 1927
div1.opener:
C. F. KARSHNER, M.D.
CORNER SHELDON & ISLAND STS.
GRAND RAPIDS., MICH.
January 22,
1 9 2 7.
Mrs. Emilie L. Reed,
% Burlington Hotel,
Washington, D.C.
My dear Mrs. Reed:-
div1.p:
I am, indeed, grateful for your prompt reply to the
request transmitted to you through Mrs. J. J. Miller, and
I trust that you will accept my heartfelt thanks for the
courtesy which you have extended me.

The pamphlet, I am indeed glad to get, and shall
cherish it among my valued medical possessions. I believe
these pamphlets are to be used in connection with the cam-
paign of education among the school children, which the
American Medical Association at the present time is engaged
in prosecuting. The clippings I have read with interest, and
gleaned a great many interesting side lights which will be
of great value to me in my talks upon Dr. Reed and Yellow
Fever which I am scheduled to deliver before the High Schools,
and the Kiwanis Club. I have the Life of Gorgus which tells
rather extensively of Dr. Reed's work. I also have a copy
of the “Microbe Hunters”, as well as the book by Sullivan on
“Our Times”. In both of which Dr. Reed's work is fairly
well outlined. Aside from these I also possess a copy of the
report of the Typhoid Commission of the Spanish American War,
and being, as Dr. Vaughn expressed it recently, “One of his
boys” at the University of Michigan years ago, and soldier
in the Spanish American War, in the brigade in which Dr.
Vaughn served, I have been rather familiar with most of the
work in which Dr. Reed was interested and engaged.

It is, I assure you, with a great deal of pleasure,
and satisfaction that I have been permitted to come even into
a remote contact with one who has a right to feel most grate-
ful for the work, for which Dr. Reed has done, and the fame
which he has attained. I was also pleased a short time ago
to meet and become fairly well acquainted with the daughter
of Dr. Reed and yourself, and I would ask that you kindly
extend my best personal regards to her.
Thanking you again for your kindness I beg to remain
div1.closer: Most gratefully yours, Cleyde F. Karshner. CFK:DEY.
